content.question: In the circuit above, the current in the <math alttext="8 ohm" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> resistor is <math alttext="4 amperes" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mi>A</mi></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> toward the top of the page and the current in the <math alttext="5 ohm" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> resistor is <math alttext="6 amperes" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mi>A</mi></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> toward the bottom of the page. What is the current in each of the <math alttext="3 ohm" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> resistors?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
